intro: Pogonopsis tenera, commonly known as the slender pogonopsis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to greenish-white, with five petals and a distinctive central column. Pogonopsis tenera is often found in humid, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
